body:
Using Single sign-on (SSO) with HackerRank allows companies of any size to leverage their existing corporate directories and authentication systems to authorize employee access to HackerRank for Work. It enables the users to log in with a single ID and password to access a connected system. SSO reduces the password fatigue for users by reducing the number of username and password combinations that they need to remember. 

HackerRank's support for SSO is built on top of an industry-standard Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) 2.0 protocol. 

For IDP initiated flow (for identity providers such as Okta and Google):

  1. You must have the admin accounts with your identity providers.
  2. You must add HackerRank as an app.
  3. To add HackerRank as an App, you must first contact our Customer Support to provide you with ACS URL and Entity ID.
  4. After you enter these, you need to send the generated metadata files to our Customer Support. After our customer support uploads this file, SSO is enabled for all the users in your organization.

You must plan a downtime of 2 hours before you ask us to complete the process to enable SSO. The users from your organization cannot login with their credentials until we upload the metadata file provided by you.
title: IDP initiated single sign-on (SSO)
